documents.document: These history interviews you're listening to are fascinating 🐱 #writingwithcats https://t.co/DUuNDagl4B

@clarke_ali Currently reading The Stolen Island by @SikotiHamiltonR - good to see light being shed on this tragic history.

@DrDreHistorian I've read all those - and they're all brilliant. So much important stuff coming out from @BWB_NZ 📚 All pretty books too!
@jgmccl I was in 30s when I finished BA - then pottered away on postgrad for years part-time. Enjoyed it more & better at it cos older 👍

Freshly picked ripe cherries and white peaches ... mmmmm #foodofthegods 🍒🍒🍒
@jgmccl remarkable that someone could think of a worse use for this significant site than a dairy farm, but they have 😢
Exhausted after writing a record 2500 words today #toomanywords #mybrainhurts #writingwithcats 🐱 https://t.co/OmO1K9GCVb

@SophieFern as long as big seas haven't washed cold waves in it's glorious! Except for the getting out bit ... brrrr
Just shared the St Clair saltwater pool with one other person 🏊🏊 Not one of Dunedin's best summers but the water's always warm!
Bonus from neglecting the garden - flowering leeks 😁 https://t.co/DJRQA1lvUg
@confluencekid oh dear - hope you recover soon. At least you don't have to go through any grim dental procedures! 😷

Just realised I'm already on my 6th cup of tea for the day - aarrgghh, better slow down! Good fuel for writing though ⛾⛾⛾ = 📝📝📝
Conducting an experiment (unplanned) this year - which parts of garden thrive best on neglect? Raspberries are 👍👍👍😊
@jgmccl Connie Willis, featuring time-travelling historians 👍

@SophieFern yes - just spotted it myself https://t.co/0vIqX7xRWY
Signal Hill fire from Macandrew Bay 😯 Warm gales causing problems here in Dunners. https://t.co/5hLiPtyq55

Lovely wee book about a friend's encounter with MS - colourful & full of dark humour. Proceeds to Wgtn MS Society https://t.co/sGT6tkE7Zm
To save a trip, asked mum if she had glace cherries for Xmas baking. Yes 👍Best before date 2008 ... hmmm 👎Now figuring out substitutes 🍒

Let me in - I want to help! No, I'm not willing to go around to the open door .... 🐱 #writingwithcats https://t.co/JSFlp6Thwv

@plinythemidlkid @DnFlatNames @Onz_Pod A lot of the worst places were demolished or fixed up. Still some substandard housing though.

@DnFlatNames It certainly looks like one! Might try DCC archives to see if they know
@DnFlatNames do you know if this one was a student flat before demolition? Ban the bomb symbol on window! https://t.co/mh6k0PPmrr

@ngataonga He once drew his own number in the ballot, but he was 45 yrs old so didn't have to go on active service! https://t.co/JRNkfIxpGs
That's my great grandfather holding the number from the first World War I conscription ballot. Such a poignant piec… https://t.co/Grop1frb0W
@ngataonga @phanzasecretary Always have mixed emotions when I see this film on display at @Te_Papa
@ngataonga @phanzasecretary My gt grandfather Malcolm Fraser was Govt Statistician. He designed & drew the ballot. Standing on right at 3.17
